Name: gān shǔ
sweet potato
甘薯
Common: yam, sweet potato (note: yam or shan yao is a different root vegetable; see: Yam and sweet potato sold in the markets in America are the roots of Ipomoea batatas L.)

Geography: Yam and sweet potato sold in the markets in America are roots of Ipomoea batatas L.)
Papua New Guinea (studies referenced New Guinea children and adults consuming sweet potato)
Maladies Treated: bleeding from ulcers of stomach and/or duodenum
Samples of Formulae:
Sweet potato sweet rice porridge 甘薯粳.

Bleeding from ulcers of stomach and/or duodenum: Make powder with dry root. Take 120 g the first time. Then take 60 g subsequently. Mix with warm boiled water.

Bleeding not during menses: use 60 g of fresh vine of sweet potato. Bake into charcoal like (but retaining the characteristic of the herb). Mix with sweet rice wine and take orally.

For boils and swelling: use appropriate amount of fresh root. Smash and wrap the affected areas.
Contraindications:
People who have diabetes, kidney disease, gout, rheumatoid arthritis or chronic pain in the vulva should avoid sweet potatoes.

It is high in oxalic acid that can cause the forming of stones of oxalates and damage the kidneys and can cause pain in joints and in vulva area.

It also possesses trypsin-inhibiting effect and it can hinder the digestion of protein.

A study on New Guinea children death caused by enteritis necroticans related to sweet potato consumption and pork consumption has been reported. There are also a few cases of enteritis necroticans reported in America.

Another study shows that certain group of New Guinea men were shorter compared to other groups with the same calorie intake and their main staple was sweet potatoes.

Sweet potatoes can also cause the inhibition of the enzyme that kills malaria amoebas and can cause dormant malaria amoebas to flare up. It may also weaken the defense against malaria; so the chances to get malaria become higher.

Enteritis necroticans is rarely reported in developed countries. The disease is likely to be under diagnosed. [3]

Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) condition, and/or with dampness or yeast infection.
Notes:
See effects of cooking of sweet potatoes on the vitamins.

Trypsin is a serine protease, an enzyme that cuts the peptide bond of protein and helps with hydrolyzing protein.

Enteritis necroticans is a segmental necrotizing infection of the jejunum and ileum caused by Clostridium perfringens, Type C.

Jejunum is the section of the small intestine between the duodenum and the ileum.

Ileum is the terminal portion of the small intestine extending from the jejunum to the cecum (beginning of the colon).
Chemical Ingredients: Vitamin A equiv. 709 μg (79% of USDA recommendation) per 100 g
lutein and zeaxanthin 0 μg per 100 g

Name: ba yue za
yu zhi zi
Biological: A. trifoliata (Thunb.) Koidz. var. australis (Diels) Rehd.

Maladies Treated: red urine and difficulty in urination
warm and discomfort in chest area
Medical Function: 疏肝理气，散结止痛 (unblocking the Liver qi, dissipating masses and relieving pain)
Samples of Formulae:
For treatment of lymph node tuberculosis: ba yue za (Akebia Fruit), jin yin zi (Cherokee rosehip), hai jin sha root (Lygodium root) 120 g each, tian kui zi (Euphorbia helioscopia seed) 240 g. Make into decoction with water. Drink in 3 days. (source: Chinese Herb Manual)

For treatment of gastro-intestine flatulence: ba yue za (Akebia Fruit) root or fruit 30 g. Boil with water. Use as tea. (Commonly Used Herb of Zhejiang People)
Contraindications: We have not found that any historical clinical record that mentioned toxicity of the herb. Use with care during pregnancy.
Chemical Ingredients: Roots contain saponins (akebin) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, which after hydrolysis yield oleanolic acid, glucose, and rhamnose.
The herb also contains glycerin stearate and linolenic acid glyceride (oleic acid glyceride, linolenic acid glyceride).

Maladies Treated: constipation due to dryness (腸燥便秘)
toxicity due to cao wu tou (烏頭毒)
Medical Function: eases the adverse effects of medicine
used in tonic pills and creams as excipients to moderate medicinal nature and for nourishing
inhibits fungi and prevents the production of aflatoxin by Aspergillus flavus
honey can be used as an effective hepatoprotective agent against paracetamol-induced liver damage [3]
Samples of Formulae:
Antidotes for cao wu tou (Aconitum carmichaelii) toxicity: use 4 tablespoons of honey each time. Mix with warm drinking water. Take orally. [1]
解烏頭毒：白蜂蜜每次至四湯匙，溫開水沖服。[1]
Contraindications:
Not recommended for children under 12 months old, pregnant women or during breastfeeding.
Side effects can include dizziness, headache, nausea, vomiting, fever, abdominal pain, diarrhea, difficulty breathing, temporary blindness, and can contribute to decreased blood pressure, and in severe cases can result in death.
Honey itself is non-toxic, but when bees take pollen from poisonous plants, the honey is brewed with toxicity.
Research:
inhibit fungi and aflatoxin [1]抑制黴菌發生. 防止黃麴黴菌產生黃黴素。[1]
Honey can be used as an effective hepatoprotective agent against paracetamol-induced liver damage. [3]蜂蜜可以用來作為對乙酰氨基酚引起的肝損傷的有效保肝劑。[3]
Physical and chemical identification:
(1) Acidity check: take 10g, add 50ml boiling over cold water, mix, add 2 drops of phenolphthalein indicator solution and sodium hydroxide (0.1 mol/L) 4ml, should show significant pink color which does not disappear within 10 seconds.
(2) Starch, dextrin check: take 2g, add 10ml water, heat to boiling, cool, add 1 drop iodine test solution; blue, green, or red-brown color should not appear.
(3) Measuring absorption rate: 5.0g honey, accurately weighed, placed in 50ml volumetric flask, add about 25ml water to dissolve. Add 0.5ml each of 15% potassium ferrocyanide solution and 30% zinc acetate solution, dilute with water to the mark (add 1 drop ethanol if needed to eliminate foam), shake, dry filter, discard initial filtrate, precisely measure 5.0ml each of filtrate into two stoppered test tubes (A and B), tube A add 5.0ml water, tube B add 5.0ml new 0.2% sodium bisulfite solution as blank, mix, absorbance measured at 284nm and 336nm wavelengths, the absorbance difference shall not exceed 0.34.
Notes:
(1) Acidity test: Take 10 g of this product, add 50 ml of freshly boiled and cooled water, mix well, add 2 drops of phenolphthalein indicator solution and 4 ml of sodium hydroxide solution (0.1 mol/L), it should show pink color, which should not disappear within 10 seconds. 
 (2) Starch and dextrin test: Take 2 g of this product, add 10 ml of water, heat and boil, cool, add 1 drop of iodine test solution, it must not show blue, green, or reddish-brown color. 
 (3) Absorbance measurement method: Take 5.0 g of honey, weigh precisely, place into a 50 ml volumetric flask, add about 25 ml of water to dissolve, add 0.5 ml each of 15% potassium ferrocyanide solution and 30% zinc acetate solution, dilute with water to the mark (add 1 drop of ethanol if necessary to eliminate foam), mix well, filter with dry filter paper, discard the initial filtrate, precisely measure 5.0 ml of the subsequent filtrate, place separately into two stoppered test tubes A and B. Tube A add 5.0 ml of water, tube B add 5.0 ml of freshly prepared 0.2% sodium bisulfite solution as blank, mix well, measure absorbance at wavelengths of 284 nm and 336 nm, the absorbance difference must not be greater than 0.34.
Chemical Ingredients: Chinese bee honey: mainly contains glucose, fructose; also contains sucrose, dextrin, organic acids, proteins, essential oils, waxes, pollen, vitamins B1, B2, B6, C, K, H, amylase, transfer enzyme, peroxidase, esterase, growth-stimulating hormone, acetylcholine, niacin, pantothenic acid, carotene, inorganic elements such as calcium, sulfur, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, sodium, iodine and other elements

Name: mao gen
bai mao gen
Biological: Imperata cylindrica (L.) P. Beauv.var. major (Nees) c. E. Hubb.
Agropyrum repens P. Beauv. (ou mao gen 歐茅根)

Maladies Treated: bleeding (cools the blood and stops bleeding)
Medical Function: promotes urination, especially during 5~10 days while taking the herb, can be due to the potassium salt in the herb
Dosage: 9 to 24 g. Using by itself, up to 60 g.
Samples of Formulae:
For hemorrhagic fever:
Formula 1: bai mao gen (mao gen), da huang (rhubarb), mang xiao (mirabilite), zhi shi (immature bitter orange), tao ren (peach kernel), sheng di huang (raw rehmannia root), mai dong (ophiopogon root), mu tong (akebia stem).

Formula 2: bai mao gen (mao gen) 150 g, dan shen (salvia root) 20 g, lu gen (reed rhizome) 30 g, huang bai (phellodendron bark) 10 g, pei lan (eupatorium) 15 g, dan pi (moutan bark) 10 g.
Adjust the formulae according to the syndrome.

For Cancer of the digestive track: bai mao gen (mao gen) 10 g, bai hua she she cao (Hedyotis diffusae/Oldenlandia) 12 g, ban zhi lian (scutellaria barbata) 10 g. Boil with water. Use as tea.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) or shenyangxu (kidney yang deficient) conditions. Use care if blood pressure is low because of its diuretic effect.

Medical Function: analgesic effect: the analgesic effect of the essential oil is mainly by the n-octyl acetate

anti-inflammatory antiseptic effect: ru xiang can promote the increase of multi-core white blood cells to swallow the dead cells and dead blood cells, improve metabolism, which in turn has anti-inflammatory effect
Samples of Formulae: For treatment of impact injuries: ru xiang (Frankincense), mo yao (Myrrh) 4.5 g each, dang gui wei (Chinese angelica tail), hong hua (Safflower flower), tao ren (Peach kernel) 9 g each. Boil with water and use as tea.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) or in cases of pregnancies.
Notes:
Ru xiang is derived from the resin of Boswellia carteri and related species from the family Burseraceae.
Mainly imported, commonly used in Chinese herbal medicine, possesses the properties of activating blood, relieving pain, reducing swelling, and promoting wound healing.
Some unscrupulous merchants adulterate with resin from other plants or starches, making them similar in appearance but with differences in properties.
Authentic ru xiang: nipple-shaped, teardrop-shaped, or irregular small granular pieces, 0.5–2 cm long, some agglomerate. Pale yellow or ivory white, semi-transparent, shiny, turns darker over time to brownish yellow, hard and brittle. When chewed, initially forms small fragments, then quickly softens to a gum, sticks to teeth, with a mild aromatic spicy sensation.
Fake ru xiang: oval, or clusters of variously sized near-round small particles forming irregular lumps, 0.5–1.8 cm, pale yellowish white, opaque, hard texture, granulated surface without luster. When chewed has a sandy feel, with a slight corn scent.
Physical identification: 1. Powder under UV (365nm) shows pale yellow fluorescence (fake: no fluorescence). 2. 90% ethanol extract under UV on filter paper: bright yellow fluorescence (fake: light yellow). 3. When boiled in water and left overnight, authentic stays emulsified and doesn’t separate (fake separates and top layer turns blue with iodine addition). 4. With acetic anhydride and concentrated sulfuric acid: authentic changes from purple-red to black-brown (fake: purple to green with undyed white precipitate). 5. Burning: authentic leaves a small amount of white ash; fake forms a black carbonaceous lump and burnt smell remains.

Chemical Ingredients: calcium salt and magnesium salt of arabic acid (20%)
essential oil: light yellow and fragrant, contains: pinene
neutral portion contains α-amyrone, α-amyrinone, derivatives of α- and β-amyrin
rubber: polysaccharide, from which polysaccharide II has been isolated

References: 劉翠昌  中國中醫藥報
